intro: Androsace bisulca, commonly known as the two-ribbed rockmaid, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring, often sitting atop short, hairy stems. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a hairy surface and a serrated edge. Androsace bisulca thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine environments.
